query.question: Can I start accepting payments on my site while my Wix Payments account is still under verification?
query.answer: You can start accepting payments on your site using [Wix Payments](https://support.wix.com/en/article/about-wix-payments) almost immediately. However, we need to verify your identity before your account can be fully activated.

results.answer:
Yes, you can start accepting payments on your Wix site with Wix Payments while your account is still under verification, but there are some important restrictions to note. Once you connect Wix Payments to your site and start accepting payments, the account status will likely be "Accepting Payments" during the verification process. During this time, customers can complete their purchases, meaning you can accept payments online. However, you will not be able to receive payouts to your bank account until the verification process is complete. 

The verification process typically requires you to submit personal, business, and bank details along with supporting documents such as a valid government-issued photo ID and a bank statement. This verification can take up to 7 business days. From the time of your first transaction, you have 30 days to complete your setup and verification, otherwise your Wix Payments account will be suspended and you will no longer be able to accept payments through Wix Payments.

So, in summary:
- You can accept payments immediately after connecting Wix Payments and before the account is fully verified.
- You cannot receive payouts until your account is verified and active.
- You must complete the verification within 30 days of your first payment to avoid suspension.
- After verification, your account becomes active, and you can receive payouts as scheduled.

To check and complete your account setup or verification, go to the Accept Payments section in your site's dashboard and follow the prompts. 

Keep in mind you must also publish your site and have a Wix Premium or Studio plan that supports payments.

If you need to update any account details during verification, your ability to accept payments continues, but payouts are temporarily paused again until re-verification is complete.

misc_response.original_query: Can I start accepting payments on my site while my Wix Payments account is still under verification?

queries: accepting payments while Wix Payments account is under verification

So, in summary:

- You cannot receive payouts until your account is verified and active.

Keep in mind you must also publish your site and have a Wix Premium or Studio plan that supports payments.

query.question: I am inquiring about purchasing the yearly premium plan for $17.00, which includes a free domain for 1 year. However, the voucher does not show up at checkout. Do I need to purchase the plan first and then will the voucher be available to activate?
query.answer: When you purchase a yearly Premium plan, the free domain voucher is not immediately visible at checkout. Instead, the voucher becomes available after you complete the purchase of the plan. You can then claim the voucher by visiting the [Premium Vouchers page](https://manage.wix.com/account/vouchers?referralAdditionalInfo=%7Btheir) in your Wix account. The voucher is valid for two months from the date of purchase, and you can use it to register a domain for free for one year. If you have already purchased the plan and still do not see the voucher, ensure that you meet all eligibility criteria, such as not having purchased a monthly plan or a domain prior to the plan. If issues persist, you can [contact Wix Customer Care](https://support.wix.com/en/article/contacting-wix-customer-care-for-support) for further assistance.

results.answer:
When you purchase the yearly premium plan for $17.00 that includes a free domain for one year, the free domain voucher is not applied automatically at checkout. Instead, it is given to you as a promotional gift with your initial purchase of the yearly plan. You need to first complete the purchase of the yearly plan. After that, you can go to the Premium Vouchers page in your account to view and claim your free domain voucher. 

This voucher is valid for two months from the date of your plan purchase, and once claimed, you follow the steps to redeem it for a new domain (or to transfer a domain to Wix). You need to enter payment information when claiming the voucher, but you will not be charged for the first year of the domain registration; the payment information is only for renewal after the free year ends. 

In summary, you do not have to have the voucher showing up at checkout. Instead, purchase the yearly premium plan first, then claim and activate the free domain voucher within your Wix account. Make sure you are purchasing a yearly or multi-year plan (monthly plans are not eligible for this voucher) and check the Premium Vouchers section to find and claim your voucher within the valid period.

The voucher is valid for two months from purchase, requires entering payment info for renewal after the first free year, and is only included with first-time yearly plan purchases, not renewals or upgrades.

query.question: I'm want to know how much it would cost to upgrade my email plan.
query.answer:
To upgrade your email marketing plan:
[Go to Email Marketing](https://www.wix.com/my-account/site-selector/?buttonText=Email%20Marketing%20Dashboard&title=Select%20a%20Site&autoSelectOnSingleSite=true&actionUrl=https://www.wix.com/dashboard/%7B%7BmetaSiteId%7D%7D/shoutout/) in your site's dashboard.  Under Monthly Balance click Upgrade.
  Choose a plan that works best for you and checkout.

results.answer: The cost to upgrade your email plan depends on the type of email service you are using and the plan features you need. For Wix email marketing plans, you can upgrade to send more emails per month by selecting a package that fits your business needs. The specific cost isn't listed but you can compare plans based on the number of emails you want to send and additional features. For Google Workspace business email plans through Wix, upgrading means moving to a higher-tier plan with increased storage and more features. The exact cost will depend on which Workspace plan you choose — Starter, Standard, or Plus — each offering different storage amounts and capabilities. When upgrading any Wix plan, including email marketing or Workspace email plans, any remaining credit from your current plan is automatically applied to the new purchase, possibly reducing the cost. The upgrade process involves going into your Wix account, selecting the upgrade option for your email or workspace plan, choosing your desired plan, and completing checkout with payment details. However, the detailed pricing for each specific email upgrade plan is not provided in the available information. If you want precise costs, the best approach is to check the upgrade options and pricing directly in your Wix site's dashboard or your Google Workspace settings within Wix. This way, you can select the plan that matches your business needs and budget.

misc_response.original_query: I'm want to know how much it would cost to upgrade my email plan.
missing_information: Specific pricing details for email plan upgrades on Wix or Google Workspace through Wix
misc_response.final_answer: The cost to upgrade your email plan depends on the type of email service you are using and the plan features you need. For Wix email marketing plans, you can upgrade to send more emails per month by selecting a package that fits your business needs. The specific cost isn't listed but you can compare plans based on the number of emails you want to send and additional features. For Google Workspace business email plans through Wix, upgrading means moving to a higher-tier plan with increased storage and more features. The exact cost will depend on which Workspace plan you choose — Starter, Standard, or Plus — each offering different storage amounts and capabilities. When upgrading any Wix plan, including email marketing or Workspace email plans, any remaining credit from your current plan is automatically applied to the new purchase, possibly reducing the cost. The upgrade process involves going into your Wix account, selecting the upgrade option for your email or workspace plan, choosing your desired plan, and completing checkout with payment details. However, the detailed pricing for each specific email upgrade plan is not provided in the available information. If you want precise costs, the best approach is to check the upgrade options and pricing directly in your Wix site's dashboard or your Google Workspace settings within Wix. This way, you can select the plan that matches your business needs and budget.

query.question: I want to know if the Wix store function work for selling services instead of just physical goods
query.answer:
Wix Stores gives you all the tools you need to create a sleek, professional online store and grow your eCommerce business.
  
Wix Bookings, however, is an easy-to-use scheduling system that lets your members book and [pay for] (https://support.wix.com/en/article/wix-bookings-about-getting-paid-online) services online, so you can focus on managing your business. Whether you offer services like workshops, courses, or private sessions, online or in-person, Wix Bookings has you covered.

results.answer:
Yes, Wix Stores can be used to sell services as well as physical goods. You can list a specific service you provide as a single "product" with a predefined price to simplify the purchasing process for clients. For example, services like a "5-year Family Financial Plan," "Tax Return Preparation," or "Contract Drafting" can be sold like pre-packaged products. This approach provides clarity on cost and scope and allows clients to pay without committing to specific dates upfront.

To sell services as products, you need to add Wix Stores to your site and upgrade to a Premium or Studio plan that supports payments. You create a service product by adding it through your site's dashboard where you enter details like name, description, price, and images just as you would with a physical product. Scheduling of appointments related to the service would need to be manually done in the Wix Bookings calendar.

Additionally, Wix allows charging clients for store products and Wix Bookings services together in the same transaction (such as at a mobile point of sale). Extra features such as tips, coupons, and discounts are also available for these sales.

In summary, Wix Stores supports selling services by listing them as products, and you can also use Wix Bookings for more traditional service scheduling and payment. This flexibility ensures Wix can handle both physical goods and service sales effectively.

misc_response.original_query: I want to know if the Wix store function work for selling services instead of just physical goods

queries: Wix store support for selling services
Wix store selling services instead of physical goods

misc_response.aggregation_answer: Wix Stores supports selling services by creating service products with predefined prices similar to physical products. You can add services through your dashboard, set prices, and include descriptions and media. Wix Bookings can be integrated for appointment scheduling, and you can sell Wix Store products and bookings services together at a mobile POS. Wix requires a Premium or Studio plan to accept payments.
misc_response.final_answer:
Yes, Wix Stores can be used to sell services as well as physical goods. You can list a specific service you provide as a single "product" with a predefined price to simplify the purchasing process for clients. For example, services like a "5-year Family Financial Plan," "Tax Return Preparation," or "Contract Drafting" can be sold like pre-packaged products. This approach provides clarity on cost and scope and allows clients to pay without committing to specific dates upfront.

To sell services as products, you need to add Wix Stores to your site and upgrade to a Premium or Studio plan that supports payments. You create a service product by adding it through your site's dashboard where you enter details like name, description, price, and images just as you would with a physical product. Scheduling of appointments related to the service would need to be manually done in the Wix Bookings calendar.

Additionally, Wix allows charging clients for store products and Wix Bookings services together in the same transaction (such as at a mobile point of sale). Extra features such as tips, coupons, and discounts are also available for these sales.

In summary, Wix Stores supports selling services by listing them as products, and you can also use Wix Bookings for more traditional service scheduling and payment. This flexibility ensures Wix can handle both physical goods and service sales effectively.

query.question: How can I add discounts to my service prices when customers pay for a plan?
query.answer:
To add discounts to your service prices when customers pay for a plan, you can create discount coupons for your pricing plans. You can choose to offer a price discount or a percentage discount coupon. You can also choose whether your discount coupons apply to a specific plan or to all your pricing plans. Your clients redeem the coupon at checkout to take advantage of the discounted plans. Note: Discount coupons for Pricing Plans cover the plans themselves, but not any setup fees you may have enabled. To create discount coupons for your pricing plans:

1. Go to Pricing Plans in your site's dashboard.
2. Click the More Actions icon at the top.
3. Click Create a coupon.
4. Select the type of coupon you want to offer:
   - $ Discount: Offer a fixed monetary discount amount.
   - % Discount: Offer a percentage discount.
5. Enter the Coupon code clients use to redeem the coupon.
6. Enter the Coupon name for your own records.
7. Click the Apply to drop-down and choose the relevant pricing plan(s):
   - All plans: This is applied to all your available pricing plans.
   - Specific plan: Click the Pricing plan drop-down and select the relevant plan.
8. Choose how the coupon works with your pricing plans:
   - First billing cycle: The coupon offers a one-time discount at the start of the pricing plan.
   - All billing cycles: The coupon offers a recurring discount, every time your client is charged.
   - Custom: You choose how your coupons work with recurring payments (e.g. give a discount for the first 4 billing cycles).
9. Select the dates the coupon is valid between.
10. (Optional) Select the Limit the total number of uses for this coupon checkbox and enter the number of times the coupon can be used.
11. (Optional) Select the Limit to one use per customer checkbox if you want clients to be able to use the coupon only one time.
12. Click Create Coupon.

results.answer:
To add discounts to your service prices when customers pay for a plan, you primarily work with pricing plans that can include either one-time or recurring payment options. You can create pricing plans that offer packages or memberships at reduced prices compared to individual services, effectively applying a discount by bundling benefits together. For example, you might offer a membership plan that includes access to multiple services at a lower monthly rate than purchasing each service separately.

When setting up or editing a pricing plan, you can adjust the plan's price and duration to reflect discounted rates. Changes to price affect new purchasers, so you can create special lower-priced plans or packages to offer discounts.

While it is not currently possible to directly add optional extra benefits that customers can choose to include for a discount, you can list and connect relevant services and content to the plan to make it attractive.

Additionally, to promote discounted plans, you can create coupons linked to your pricing plans as a way to offer explicit discounts.

In summary, to implement discounts when customers pay for a plan:
1. Create a new pricing plan or edit an existing one.
2. Set a discounted price for the plan under "Pricing options".
3. Connect the relevant services and benefits that are included in the plan.
4. Optionally create coupons for additional promotional discounts.

This approach allows you to offer different pricing tiers, bundles, or packages that effectively provide discounts compared to individual service pricing.

Note: You cannot currently add optional extra benefits that customers selectively include for discounts within a plan, but you can adjust overall prices and benefits connected to the plan.

queries: add discounts to service prices when customers pay for a plan
